Mathar_, May 13 2006: "Also flattened table of the expansion coefficients of x^n in Chebyshev Polynomials T_k(x) of the first kind:"x^n is 2^(1-n) multiplied by the sum of floor(1+n/2) terms using only terms T_k(x) with even k if n even, only terms T_k(x) with odd k if n is odd and halving the coefficient a(..) in front of any T_0(x):"x^0=2^(1-0) a(0)/2 T_0(x)"x^1=2^(1-1) a(1) T_1(x)"x^2=2^(1-2) [a(2)/2 T_0(x)+a(3) T_2(x)]"x^3=2^(1-3) [a(4) T_1(x)+a(5) T_3(x)]"x^4=2^(1-4) [a(6)/2 T_0(x)+a(7) T_2(x) +a(8) T_4(x)]"x^5=2^(1-5) [a(9) T_1(x)+a(10) T_3(x) +a(11) T_5(x)]"x^6=2^(1-6) [a(12)/2 T_0(x)+a(13) T_2(x) +a(14) T_4(x) +a(15) T_6(x)]"x^7=2^(1-7) [a(16) T_1(x)+a(17) T_3(x) +a(18) T_5(x) +a(19) T_7(x)]" (End)T(n,k) = A034868(n,floor(n/2)-k), k = 0..floor(n/2). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 27 2012
